IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO HELP EDUCATE THE CREATIVE MINORITY OF A CIVILIZATION, TO DEVELOP IN HARMONY THE INTELLECTUAL, SPIRITUAL, AESTHETIC, SOCIAL, AND PHYSICAL QUALITIES WHICH CHARACTERIZE WHOLENESS OF PERSON. SEE SCH O.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO HELP EDUCATE THE CREATIVE MINORITY OF A CIVILIZATION, TO DEVELOP IN HARMONY THE INTELLECTUAL, SPIRITUAL, AESTHETIC, SOCIAL, AND PHYSICAL QUALITIES WHICH CHARACTERIZE WHOLENESS OF PERSON. SEE SCH O.

Activity2.Description: STUDENT SERVICES: ADMISSIONS, ACTIVITIES, STUDENT AID ADMINISTRATION, HEALTH, GOVERNMENT, ATHLETICS, RECREATION AND ADVISING.

Activity3.Description: AUXILIARY ENTERPRISES: ROOM, BOARD, PRINTING AND SUPPORT SERVICES.

OtherLiabilities.Description: ACCTS HELD ON BEHALF OF OTHERS

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: INTENDED USE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH DONOR RESTRICTIONS FOR THE FOLLOWING PURPOSES: STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS (54%), GENERAL OPERATIONS (22%), INSTRUCTION AND ACADEMIC SUPPORT (13%), LIBRARY (6%), AND OTHER MISCELLANEOUS CAMPUS PROGRAMS (5%).

CHANGE IN ASSUMPTIONS ON HEALTH BENEFITS ACCUM = (3,228,857) NET GAIN ON DEFINED BENEFIT PLAN = (853,326) NET LOSS & SERVICE CREDIT ON DEFINED BENEFIT PLAN = (409,719) ----------- (4,551,902) OTHER ADJUSTMENTS SCHEDULE D, PART XII, LINE 4B GRANTS & SCHOLARSHIPS = 31,481,545 NET LOSS & SERVICE CREDIT ON DEFINED BENEFIT PLAN = 409,719 NET GAIN ON DEFINED BENEFIT PLAN = 853,326 ------------- 32,744,590 OTHER ADJUSTMENTS SCHEDULE D, PART XIII, LINE 4B GRANTS & SCHOLARSHIPS = 31,481,545

THERE WAS NO FIN 48 FOOTNOTE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOLLOWING PARAGRAPH IS FROM THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS REGARDING INCOME TAXES. THE UNIVERSITY IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(A) OF THE U.S. INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, AND BY A SIMILAR PROVISION OF STATE LAW. THE UNIVERSITY IS SUBJECT TO FEDERAL INCOME TAX ON ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS TAXABLE INCOME. THE UNIVERSITY'S TAX YEARS STILL SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES ARE YEARS SUBSEQUENT TO 2007.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: WITTENBERG UNIVERSITY IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH REV.PROC. 75-50
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: WITTENBERG UNIVERSITY RECEIVES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FROM THE U.S. GOVERNMENT IN CONNECTION WITH THE PELL GRANT AND SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT PROGRAMS. WITTENBERG UNIVERSITY ALSO RECEIVES SUPPORT FROM THE STATES OF OHIO AND PENNSYLVANIA FOR CERTAIN PROGRAMS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION USES STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES TO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. WITTENBERG UNIVERSITY ONLY AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL AND PRIVATELY FUNDED FINANCIAL AID AWARD AS ASSISTANCE FOR STUDENTS BASED ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS, BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. IN DOING SO, THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ADHERES STRICTLY TO ALL FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS AND IS SUBJECT TO THE COMPLIANCE AND INTERNAL CONTROL REQUIREMENTS OF OMB-A133, IN WHICH THEY FOLLOW ALL APPLICABLE GUIDELINES.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: DARRELL KITCHEN RECEIVES A CLUB MEMBERSHIP, WHICH IS INCLUDED IN HIS TAXABLE COMPENSATION. MARK ERICKSON, THE UNIVERSITY'S PRESIDENT, RECEIVES PERSONAL USE OF A RESIDENCE, A CLUB MEMBERSHIP, AND A STORAGE UNIT. THE CLUB MEMBERSHIP AND THE STORAGE UNIT (COSTING APPROXIMATELY $650 ANNUALLY) ARE INCLUDED IN HIS TAXABLE COMPENSATION. THE PERSONAL USE OF A RESIDENCE IS NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE COMPENSATION. THE RESIDENCE IS FURNISHED FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF WITTENBERG UNIVERSITY. THE PRESIDENT IS REQUIRED TO LIVE IN THE RESIDENCE AS A CONDITION OF HIS EMPLOYMENT, AND THE RESIDENCE IS CONTIGOUS TO WITTENBERG'S CAMPUS.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION USES SECURITY TRUST TO SELL STOCK GIFTS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART I, LINE 1 & PART III, LINE 1
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WITTENBERG UNIVERSITY'S FUNDAMENTAL PURPOSE IS TO HELP EDUCATE "THE CREATIVE MINORITY OF A CIVILIZATION," TO DEVELOP IN HARMONY THE INTELLECTUAL, SPIRITUAL, AESTHETIC, SOCIAL, AND PHYSICAL QUALITIES WHICH CHARACTERIZE WHOLENESS OF PERSON.

WITTENBERG UNIVERSITY CURRENTLY ENROLLS APPROXIMATELY 1,792 FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHO PURSUE DEGREES IN MORE THAN 35 MAJOR FIELDS OF STUDY. THE UNIVERSITY HOLDS GENERAL ACCREDITATION FROM THE NORTH CENTRAL ASSOCIATION OF COLLEGES AND SCHOOLS AND SOME DEPARTMENTS HOLD SPECIALTY ACCREDITATIONS. EFFECTIVE DECEMBER 1, 2000, THE OHIO BOARD OF REGENTS GRANTED THE UNIVERSITY AN AMENDED CERTIFICATE OF AUTHORIZATION TO CONFER THE DEGREES OF BACHELOR OF ARTS, BACHELOR OF SCIENCE, BACHELOR OF FINE ARTS, BACHELOR OF MUSIC, BACHELOR OF MUSIC EDUCATION, AND MASTER OF ARTS IN EDUCATION. THE REGENTS ALSO APPROVED THE UNIVERSITY IN THE FOLLOWING TEACHER LICENSURE FIELDS: EARLY CHILDHOOD, MIDDLE CHILDHOOD, INTERVENTION SPECIALIST: MILD/MODERATE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS; ADOLESCENT TO YOUNG ADULT: EARTH SCIENCES, INTEGRATED LANGUAGE ARTS, INTEGRATED MATHEMATICS, INTEGRATED SOCIAL STUDIES, AND LIFE SCIENCES; MULTI-AGE: DRAMA/THEATER, FOREIGN LANGUAGE, MUSIC AND VISUAL ARTS.
THE 990 WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE ON THE BOARD'S WEB PORTAL BEFORE FILING. THE ORGANIZATION'S CONTROLLER AND AUDIT COMMITTEE WILL DO A DETAILED REVIEW OF THE RETURN PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: MONITORING & ENFORCEMENT OF COMPLIANCE WITH CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO ANNUALLY COMPLETE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE. REPORTED POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE DISCLOSED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND DISCUSSED. IF A CONFLICT IS FOUND, THE MEMBER WITH THE CONFLICT ABSTAINS FROM VOTING ON THE RELATED ISSUE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PROCESS TO REVIEW PRESIDENT, OFFICER, & KEY EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: PRESIDENT, OFFICER, & KEY EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED USING COMPENSATION SURVEYS AND COMPENSATION DATA FROM PEER INSTITUTIONS. THE REVIEWS WERE LAST CONDUCTED IN JUNE 2009. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWED THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION, AND THE PRESIDENT REVIEWED OFFICER AND KEY EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION IN JUNE 2009.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: AVAILABILITY OF GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, COI POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
KATHERINE BLADH IS KEN BLADH'S FAMILY MEMBER. LIN ERICKSON IS MARK ERICKSON'S FAMILY MEMBER.
